answers.answer: Dear Monica,Your endocrinologist can evaluate the possibility of insulin-producing tumors by concurrently measuring insulin and glucos levels.  It i simportant to ask the doctor why the diagnosis of dumping was made.  You did not mention any prior gastric surgery.  A gastric emptying test may provide information regarding the possibility of dumping.

I don't know the exact spelling but it sounds like you might have a "theochromocytoma" (probably sic)!! It a cyst on the adrenal gland that CAN produce the symtoms similar to yours.It can also cause flucuating B.P.,cold sweats,dizziness, It is a very RARE occurence to have a "theo/phyo". It can be diagnosed by an IVP  (x-ray) and by a urine collection (24hrs).I would advise you to see a good internist ASAP regarding your problem..good luck

question: I am a 35 year old female and for the past three years I have experienced constant lightheadedness, fatigue, difficulty concentrating.  These symptoms worsen after I eat foods with sugar or high in carbs.  Almost immediatly after eating even a small piece of candy I can feel a reaction. I have seen an endocinologist and diabetes was ruled out. She also did a cortisol test which was negative.  She concluded I probably have reactive hypoglycemia with an underlying problem that she could not diagnose.  I then saw the gastroenterologist who performed a colonoscopy and later an endoscopy, both normal.  He feels that since my sensitivity to sugar is a result of gastric dumping and is trying to slow down my digestion.  I am taking 10mg of Bentyl three times a day.  It just makes me more tired, although it has helped my irratible bowel.  I have read about insulin producing tumors and am wondering if this could produce the symptoms I am having?  Any information would be appreciated.ThanksMonica
